column4: I'm having trouble with my usb ports in Ubuntu. When I plug in it either won't detect it or partially detects it but can't mount it. lsusb will freeze when I try it
Can someone help with getting Usb drives working?
Whats going on?

I'm trying to connect my Droid X and Fuze v2 to my Ubuntu laptop. The usb is working very sporadically, one day things connect the next nothing. When I run lsusb it will freeze sometimes or detect the device but I can't mount it.
I thought you meant HD's  I'm not  familiar in that area. :)
k, is there any where I can get some help because this started up randomly when I somehow updated to 11.04 without knowing it and it's a pain in the butt
some help here I assume your running ubuntu, there is alsp ##linux, being specific of the devices is helpful. :)
are you unmounting with a right click safely remove device as well?
it won't even mount them. when I remove them I safely remove them usually
but lets assume I didn't once
cool, hard to say if that is a factor but personaly I'm retentive with my externals that way.
anyways I'm normally pretty good about safely removing
ubuntu is pretty forgiving there but the devices may not be, just guessing though.
I'll check the devices for errors on windows but there shouldn't be anything wrong with them. I've recently reformatted the fuze and it was working fine then just stopped
you have to rember though that linux and windows are completely different so no erors in windows is not a cause and effect in linux.
have you been in the #android channel as well? you know how to search for or get a channel list I assume.
I'm back and my device mounted. I had to have it plugged in before Ubuntu started up
hmm, do you have it in fstab?
One second
I wouldn't just wondering.
cool hope it continues to work.
I have a strong feeling it will stop working next time I restart without having something plugged in like this
